events.comment:
The terrain cells are linked to their neighbors to allow to find paths in the "Board Resolution" section.

2 instances of the same object can't be linked together so 2 objects are used:
- Terrain, linked to its neighbors TerrainLink
- TerrainLink, linked to its neighbors Terrain

The TerrainLinks and Terrains that superpose are not linked to one another because it would mess with the distance (in node count or node weight).
There is actually 2 independent link networks. This is why elements on the map are linked to the Terrain and the TerrainLink of their cell.

LevelTerrain is a group that contains one object for each kind of terrain because it's easier to design level that way, but it's not used for the gameplay.
To avoid updating the map continuously
The player chose a cell to move the unit
Make sure that no selection can happen when a unit is moving
Clear the selection when the player is not clicking on any units
Unselect the unit when the player clicks on it again
Search the cells where the unit can go
Filter cells occupied by another unit
The cost class defines which kind of terrain the unit can go and how much movement point it costs.

Link the Unit to their terrain cell to be able to find a path from the unit to another cell.
Mark their cells as occupied to act as an obstacle in path searches.
Search every cell that is near a unit and mark it as visible
Make units of the other team disappear when they are in the fog

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides: 
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.

Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_global_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the global variable _PARAM1_ exist

events.inlineCode:
const globalVariables = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = globalVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_scene_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the scene variable _PARAM1_ exist

events.inlineCode:
const sceneVariables = runtimeScene.getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = sceneVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_object_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: Object _PARAM1_ has object variable _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Delete a global variable, removing it from memory.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Delete_global_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete global variable _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().remove(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

parameters.description: Name of the global variable to delete
parameters.name: GlobalVariableName

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the text of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_scene_variable_string
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the scene variable _PARAM1_ with text: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the text of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_global_variable_string
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the global variable _PARAM1_ with text: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setString(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the value of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_global_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the global variable _PARAM1_ with value: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setNumber(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Modify the value of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Modify_scene_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the scene variable _PARAM1_ with value: _PARAM2_

events.inlineCode:
const variable = runtimeScene.getVariables().get(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));
variable.setNumber(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableValue"));

eventsFunctions.description: Delete scene variable, the variable will be deleted from the memory.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Delete_scene_variable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete the scene variable _PARAM1_

events.inlineCode: runtimeScene.getVariables().remove(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

parameters.description: Name of the scene variable to delete
parameters.name: SceneVariableName

eventsFunctions.description: Copy an object variable from one object to another
eventsFunctions.name: A_CopyObjectVariable
eventsFunctions.sentence: Copy the variable _PARAM1_ of _PARAM2_ to the variable _PARAM3_ of _PARAM4_

parameters.longDescription: To copy the variable between 2 instances of the same object, the variable has to be copied to another object first.
parameters.name: TargetObject

eventsFunctions.description: Copy all object variables from one object to another
eventsFunctions.name: A_CopyAllObjectVariables
eventsFunctions.sentence: Copy all variables from _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the text of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: GlobalVariableString

eventsFunctions.description: Return the text of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: VariableString

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of a global variable.
eventsFunctions.name: GlobalVariable

eventsFunctions.description: Return the value of a scene variable.
eventsFunctions.name: Variable

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This provides:
* "Can reach through links" conditions, useful to check if an object is linked to another through one or more other linked objects.
* a path finding movement behavior that uses objects links (instead of obstacles for the other behavior)

For instance, it can be helpful for grid-based games like:
* Match-3 (see BimBam example)
* Tactical (see Tactical example)
* City builders (find a path on a road, check the junction between 2 building...)
* Point and click (bypass obstacles with a predetermined polygonal chain)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinkTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to use Linked Objects as a graph and a path finding movement behavior

eventsFunctions.fullName: Link to neighbors on a rectangular grid
eventsFunctions.name: LinkRectangularNeighbors

parameters.longDescription: The 2 objects can't be the same.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Take into account all "_PARAM1_" that can reach _PARAM2_ through at most a cost of: _PARAM3_ according to cost class: _PARAM4_

parameters.description: if they can reach this object.
parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Leave empty to make everything crossable with cost = 1. It looks in the variable children of linktools_Cost. No child means not crossable, the cost must be positive.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Take into account all "_PARAM1_" that can reach _PARAM2_ through at most _PARAM3_ links according to cost class: _PARAM4_

parameters.description: if they can reach this object.
parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Leave empty to make everything crossable with cost = 1. It looks in the variable children of linktools_Cost. No child means not crossable, the cost can be 0 or 1.
parameters.name: CostClass

eventsFunctions.description: Can reach through links

parameters.description: if they can reach this object.
parameters.name: TargetObject

eventsFunctions.description: Cost sum

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The object will move from one object instance to another according to how they are linked to one another to reach a targeted object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinkPathFinding

events.comment: Move the object along the path

eventsFunctions.description: Move the object to a position

eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ to _PARAM3_ passing by _PARAM2_ using cost class _PARAM4_

events.comment:
Search the path and set the result in the path variable.
This variable is use by doStepPreEvent to move the object along the path.
